lexUnit.name: regalia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the distinctive clothing and trappings of high office, worn at formal occasions.

sentence.text: Wan and red-eyed , and nearly always male , they wore rebel chic regalia and communicated in either a hyperactive babble or a laboured monotone .

Tammuz managed to catch Roirbak just as he was making the finishing touches to his evening regalia : black , matt silk suit with thread-wide yellow pinstripe , understated gold adornments , I-Ching earrings .
The faces grinning from the tatty punk regalia looked so depraved and hollow-eyed that I could not bear to think of my American blues friends calling them ` sir " .
About 4,000 people marched along the twisting country road to the site , led by a traditional pipe band in full regalia .
Some of them were dressed in Ottoman regalia or Arab dress or even French cavalry uniform , serious-looking young men who -- in the later pictures -- were carrying Lee-Enfield service rifles .
Still , no chance of that with a Starfleet commander in full regalia waiting to meet you .
During the great party rallies at Nuremberg Himmler and the SS hierarchy rode through the streets on horseback , dressed in the full regalia of Teutonic knights .
He did so wearing his coral regalia .
Aunt Tossie , Mrs Florence Fox-Collier , was Maman 's ( Lady Forester 's ) elder and widowed sister -- widowed for two years but still wearing full mourning regalia .
The New Musical Express , stumbling after the new wave , advertised bells and full hippy regalia , from the people who had brought Beatle jackets to the young .
She dressed them up in full nineteenth century bourgeois feminine regalia and had them flower arranging or idling by the mantelpiece as in ` Angela " .
Jeff Starr has changed his name to Spotted Eagle and plans to tour the country dressed in full Red Indian regalia .
An exhibition of University regalia was on display in the MacRoberts Arts Centre including : Silver gifts to the University , hoods representing degrees , Chancellors ' gowns and the mace .
